required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Walking Exercise on Memory, Subjective Cognitive Complaint, and Brain-derived Neurotrophic Factor for Hypertension
clinical_study.official_title: A Longitudinal Study of the Individualized Walking Exercise Program on Memory, Subjective Cognitive Complaint, and Brain-derived Neurotrophic Factor (BDNF) Among Postmenopausal Hypertensive Women

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine the effect of 6-month individualized walking intervention program on memory and subjective cognitive complaints, and BDNF for postmenopausal hypertensive women. Participants will be randomly assigned to the experimental group and the control group. The intervention group will last for 24 weeks. The measurements include, global cognitive function, memory function, subjective cognitive complaints, and BDNF.

detailed_description.textblock: The purpose of this study is to explore an individualized walking program on memory function, subjective cognitive complaints, and BDNF, and cognitive and exercise experiences for postmenopausal hypertensive women using mix methods. This study will include a qualitative study with in depth interview of the subjects who attend the pilot study in our research team. Their experience about cognitive decline and exercise will be explored and be used to modify intervention program. The qualitative results will be analyzed using content analysis. In quantitative study with experimental design, qualified subjects will be randomly assigned to experimental or control group. Experimental subjects will perform six-month walking exercise program and control group receive routine care. The measures include assessment of memory function, serum BDNF, and questionnaires. Data will be collected at baseline, the end of the six-month intervention. Data will be analyzed using Generalized Estimation Equation evaluate the effect of the intervention program. The method will strengthen the effectiveness of six-month walking exercise program and may provide comprehensive understanding if the trajectory of behavior changes among postmenopausal women with hypertension.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: We will conduct a single-blinded, randomized controlled study. Eighty participants will be randomly assigned to the experimental group and the control group.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline outcome measure at 24th week (post-test)
primary_outcome.description: The Hopkins Verbal Learning Test will be administered to measure verbal learning and memory. The score is a sum of correct responses in each of three learning trial (encoding) (possible score 0 to 36 for summed recall of trials) and a delayed recall trial (possible score 0 to 12). Higher scores mean a better memory.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline outcome measure at 24th week (post-test)
primary_outcome.description: Cognitive Failures Questionnaire will be used to assess subjective cognitive impairment. Each item is rated from 0 to 4 with the total score calculated as the sum of all items ranging from 0 to 100 with higher scores indicating higher levels of cognitive failures.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline outcome measure at 24th week (post-test)
secondary_outcome.description: Blood will be collected. BDNF level will be determined at an absorbance of 450 nm using optical density values based on the standard curve value.

other_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline outcome measure at 24th week (post-test)
other_outcome.description: The procedures for BP measurement both before and after patients take test,BP will measure with a calibrated automated oscillometric noninvasive validated BP device.

other_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline outcome measure at 24th week (post-test)
other_outcome.description: Sleep quality will measure using Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index. The global sleep quality score ranged from 0 to 21, and candidates of more than 5 were labeled as having poor sleep quality.

other_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline outcome measure at 24th week (post-test)
other_outcome.description: Center Epidemiologic Studies Depression scale is used to measure depressive symptoms. The maximum score is 60, and higher scores are associated with depression. The scores of 16 or higher have generally been thought to indicate clinically relevant depressive symptoms.

other_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline outcome measure at 24th week (post-test)
other_outcome.description: The Montreal Cognitive Assessment is a cognitive screening instrument created and validated. The scores range from 0 to 30, higher score reflect to better global cognitive function.

arm_group.description: Behavioral: walking exercise The intervention was 24 weeks walking intervention program 5 sessions a week for 30 minutes per section walking exercise with moderate-intensity wearable device assisted.
Given a balanced life health education manual for the participants.

intervention.description: The intervention was 24 weeks walking exercise program. Participants exercised frequency at 5 sessions a week for 30 minutes per section with moderate-intensity and wearable device assisted. Each session consisted of a 5 minutes warm-up, moderate-intensity walking exercises and 5 minutes cool-down.To monitor participant's compliance, we will provide diary book, biweekly phone call, and monthly home visit.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1) aged 50-70 years old; 2) Absence of menstrual periods for 12 consecutive months by self-reports.3) A diagnosed of hypertension â‰¥ 6 months. 4) Not have regular exercise . 5) Could walk without others disease affected walking ability at baseline. 6) Able to speak and write in mandarin.
Exclusion Criteria:
Women were excluded to participate if they had the condition known to affect cognitive function (e.g., history of neurologic deficit such as stroke, Alzheimer disease, epilepsy, head injury dementia, or Parkinson disease; had history of recurrent mental disorder diagnosis; history of drug or alcohol abuse; renal failure requiring hemodialysis and terminal cancer; and encephalopathy).

eligibility.gender_description: participant eligibility is based on self-representation of gender identity.
